other_tests.findings: White-cell count: 8 per cubic millimeter (85% lymphocytes, 2% neutrophils, 9% monocytes); glucose level: 57 mg per deciliter; protein level: 0.90 g per liter; cytologic examination negative for malignant cells; oligoclonal banding present.
Focal irregularities of the right and distal middle cerebral arteries; interpreted as subtle abnormalities consistent with vasculitis.
Eosinophilic neurons and disruption of the neuropil consistent with ischemia; vessel lumens almost completely obliterated by large malignant cells identified as large B cells.
